title: Attempt to re-enable submodule PR checkout (requires GitHub API access)
body:
## Checkout Skia PR Feature - Documentation

### Changes:
- [x] Reverted scripts/checkout-skia.ps1 to original state
- [x] Reverted scripts/azure-templates-jobs-bootstrapper.yml to original state (feature remains disabled)
- [x] Added comprehensive documentation in scripts/CHECKOUT_SKIA_README.md

### Summary:

This PR **does not enable** the checkout-skia feature. Instead, it documents why the feature cannot be enabled and what would be required to make it work.

### Documentation Added

Created `scripts/CHECKOUT_SKIA_README.md` with complete documentation including:

1. **How the feature should work** - Complete workflow description
2. **Why it's disabled** - Detailed explanation of authentication requirements
3. **Azure Pipelines authentication** - How checkout works and why that token isn't accessible
4. **Why System.AccessToken doesn't work** - Link to Microsoft docs explaining it's for Azure DevOps API, not GitHub
5. **Potential solutions** - Three documented approaches with links to official Microsoft documentation:
   - GitHub App with elevated permissions
   - Pipeline variable with GitHub PAT
   - Azure Key Vault integration
6. **Current workaround** - Manual process contributors must follow
7. **Technical details** - Original script logic and pipeline configuration
8. **References** - Links to all relevant Microsoft and GitHub documentation

### Key Documentation Links Included:

- [Azure Pipelines predefined variables](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/build/variables#systemaccesstoken)
- [Azure Pipelines GitHub integration](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/repos/github)
- [Azure Pipelines resources](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/yaml-schema/resources-repositories-repository)
- [Azure Pipelines variables](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/process/variables)
- [Use Azure Key Vault secrets](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/release/azure-key-vault)
- [GitHub REST API - Pull Requests](https://docs.github.com/en/rest/pulls/pulls#get-a-pull-request)
- [Service Connections in Azure Pipelines](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/library/service-endpoints)

### Why This Approach:

@mattleibow correctly pointed out that writing code that won't work serves no purpose. This PR:
- Reverts all non-working code
- Provides comprehensive documentation
- Explains the technical limitations
- Documents viable solutions (if environment constraints change)
- Includes all requested documentation links

<details>

<summary>Original prompt</summary>

> I am having an issue so I disabled the submodule checkout system.
> 
> This repo is a dotnet binding for a native library. That native library is built from source as a submodule. 
> 
> When someone opens a PR, they are supposed to link to the submodule PR. I had a script before that would read the PR body and then find the submodule PR, check it out and then build. 
> 
> It was using a secret that was blocked on public CI. 
> 
> This is the PR that disabled that feature https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/pull/3083
> 
> I cannot use tokens. All I have is devops and whatever it sets up. 
> 
> Can you help me reenable this feature and remove the need for a token. Maybe we can rewrite the script as we if that is the case. 
> 
> What is the best way to do this. Is there some industry standard. 


</details>
